statements.statement: It is important to investigate the impact of code reviews on defect detection or repair.
It is important to investigate the impact of code reviews on code quality.
It is important to investigate the impact of code reviews on detection or fixes of security issues.
It is important to investigate the impact of code reviews on software design.
It is important to investigate the impact of code reviews on teams' understanding of the code under review .
It is important to investigate the impact of code reviews on peer impression in terms of trust, reliability, perception of expertise, and friendship.
It is important to investigate the impact of code reviews on knowledge dissemination.
It is important to investigate the impact of code reviews on time and motivation to contribute.
It is important to investigate the impact of code reviews on developers' attitude.
It is important to investigate the impact of static code analysis on the code review process.
It is important to investigate the impact of symbolic execution on the code review process.
It is important to investigate the impact of gamification elements on the code review process.
It is important to investigate the impact of continuous integration on the code review process.
It is important to investigate the impact of code change descriptions on the code review process.
It is important to investigate the impact of code size changes on the code review process.
It is important to investigate the impact of commit history coherence on the code review process.
It is important to investigate the impact of review participation history on the code review process.
It is important to investigate when code reviews should be performed.
It is important to investigate what the code review benefits are, besides finding defects.
It is important to investigate how review requests are distributed (unicast, e.g. Jira, vs. broadcast, e.g. a mailing list).
It is important to investigate the efficiency and effectiveness of code reviews compared to team walkthroughs.
It is important to investigate the impact of mentioning peers in code review comments.
It is important to investigate reviews of test code.
It is important to investigate the decision making process in the code review process.
It is important to investigate the difference between pre and post-commit code reviews.
It is important to investigate strategies for merging pull requests.
It is important to investigate motivations, challenges and best practices of the code review process.
It is important to investigate the relation between review performance and reviewers’ age and experience.
It is important to investigate the relation between review performance and reviewers’ attention span.
It is important to investigate the relation between review performance and reviewers’ workload.
It is important to investigate the relation between review performance and reviewers’ social interactions.
It is important to investigate the relation between review performance and reviewers’ understanding of each other's comments.
It is important to investigate the relation between review performance and reviewers’ reviewing patterns and focus.
It is important to investigate the relation between review performance and reviewers’ perception of code quality.
It is important to investigate the difference between core and irregular reviewers in terms of the review requests amount, frequency and speed.
It is important to investigate the difference between core and irregular reviewers in terms of the activity, involvement and commitment.
It is important to investigate the difference between core and irregular reviewers in terms of the likelihood of change request acceptance.
It is important to investigate the difference between core and irregular reviewers in terms of the level of agreement between reviewers.
It is important to investigate the difference between core and irregular reviewers in terms of career paths.
It is important to investigate the difference between core and irregular reviewers in terms of the ability to find vulnerabilities.
It is important to investigate the effect of number of involved reviewers on code reviews.
It is important to investigate the effect of individual and team motivation on code reviews.
It is important to investigate the effect of fairness of code review prioritization on code reviews.
It is important to investigate the effect of satisfaction of information needs on code reviews.
It is important to investigate support for analyzing the sentiment/attitude in code reviews.
It is important to investigate support for determining the usefulness of code reviews.
It is important to investigate support for identifying the intention in code reviews.
It is important to investigate support for estimating code review effort.
It is important to investigate support for monitoring review performance and quality.
It is important to investigate support for selection or ordering of code to review.
It is important to investigate support for selection of appropriate code reviewers.
It is important to investigate support for understanding the code changes that need to be reviewed.
It is important to investigate support for code reviews on touch-enabled devices.
It is important to investigate support for managing code reviews.
It is important to investigate support for automating code quality assessment.
It is important to investigate support for estimating the review outcome.
